meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to two connected rings or cycles.
meanings.sent1: The bicyclic structure of the molecule makes it stable.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the bicyclic compound under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The bicyclic design of the playground equipment delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a bicyclic path, always circling back to the same idea.
meanings.sent5: The bicyclic pattern on the fabric was eye-catching.

meanings.definition: Having two connected rings or cycles.
meanings.sent1: The bicyclic molecule exhibited unique properties.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful picture of the bicyclic structure.
meanings.sent3: The bicyclic pattern on the rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a bicyclic maze, trying to navigate through conflicting thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The bicyclic shape of the earrings caught her eye.

meanings.definition: Involving or characterized by two connected rings or cycles.
meanings.sent1: The bicyclic reaction proceeded smoothly in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The bicyclic nature of the process was well understood by the researchers.
meanings.sent3: The bicyclic route to the park was scenic and enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions followed a bicyclic pattern, cycling between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The bicyclic structure of the bridge was both functional and artistic.
